dt-option.name: stateRestore.colReorder
dt-option.summary: Enable/Disable saving the order of the columns

type.description: True if order of appearance of the columns across the table are to be saved, false if not.

dt-option.default: The default value for the `-init stateRestore.colReorder` option is `true` meaning that as standard the order of the columns across the table are saved.
dt-option.description:
This option allows for the saving of the order of the columns across the table to be enabled or disabled. It is only applicable when `-init stateRestore` is being used with `-init colReorder`.
As default the value is true, meaning that the order of the columns across the table will be saved. If this option is set to false, the order of the columns across the table will not be saved.
Take a look at [this example]([../extensions/StateRestore/examples/customisation/noColReorder.html) to see this in action.
This option is different to the `-init stateRestore.order` option. It decides whether to save the order of the data within the columns (ascending/descending). This option decides whether to save the order of the columns horizontally across the table, something that is changeable with the `-init colReorder` option.
